overview_summary: All five profiled neighbors have an **unknown stance** (none have publicly stated support or opposition to the development). They are predominantly private landowners with **low** community influence; none hold public office or prominent leadership roles locally.

neighbors.name: Daniel Corey Richey
neighbors.claims: A fence on the Richey property line has stood since 1936, indicating long-term family ownership of the land ([app.midpage.ai](https://app.midpage.ai/document/richey-v-county-of-anderson-10603849#:~:text=feet%20at%20Mr,northern%20property%20line%20since%201936)). In 2000, county officials attempted to extend a road (Catrina Lane) through the Richeys’ land; the Richey family sued to block it, defending their property rights against public access ([app.midpage.ai](https://app.midpage.ai/document/richey-v-county-of-anderson-10603849#:~:text=Richey%20to%20inform%20him%20that,would%20remove%20it%20for%20him)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a trusted community figure meet one-on-one, acknowledging the Richey family's long tenure on the land and assuring the project will respect his property boundaries and rights.

neighbors.name: Juanita G. Creamer
neighbors.claims: Juanita Creamer (born 1944) is an Anderson County resident in Belton, SC, with a listed address on Skyland Drive ([freepeoplesearch.com](https://freepeoplesearch.com/Creamer/Juanita/#:~:text=Juanita%20Creamer%20Belton%2C%20SC%20,September%201944)) ([freepeoplesearch.com](https://freepeoplesearch.com/Creamer/Juanita/#:~:text=Address%20History%3A%20211%20Skyland%20Drive%2C,Belton%2C%20SC%2029627)). No evidence was found of her participating in local government or speaking on development issues; her public profile appears limited to being a long-time private resident.

approach_recommendations.engage: Approach through a neighbor or community acquaintance she trusts, keeping the conversation respectful and low-key. Emphasize minimal disruption to her daily life and listen to any personal concerns she may share.

neighbors.name: Kimberly Denise Milam & Anthony Tyler Milam
neighbors.claims: Kimberly and Anthony Milam are a married couple identified as owners of a parcel in Anderson County (PIN 225-06-03-003) ([it.scribd.com](https://it.scribd.com/document/650687937/Anderson-County-SC-May-2-2023-Sale-Results#:~:text=Anderson%20County%20SC%20May%202,2023%20Sale%20Results)). They have no notable public profile in the community; their names do not appear in local news archives or meeting records related to development ([www.menstoppingviolence.org](https://www.menstoppingviolence.org/people/kimberly-milam/#:~:text=48%20people%20found%20for%20Kimberly,phone)).

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Milams together with transparency and factual information. Address any questions about how the project might affect their property or daily routine, and clarify that community aspects like traffic and property values will be managed responsibly.

neighbors.name: Charles Dean Gillespie
neighbors.claims: Charles D. Gillespie is listed as a landowner of parcel 225-06-03-011 in Anderson County records ([it.scribd.com](https://it.scribd.com/document/650687937/Anderson-County-SC-May-2-2023-Sale-Results#:~:text=Anderson%20County%20SC%20May%202,2023%20Sale%20Results)). He does not hold any known public office or committee membership; the Gillespie name appears in local context only in private capacities (e.g., a retired resident making a small political donation) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/elec2/08/elec-ANDERSON-SC-08.html#:~:text=RAY%20GILLESPIE%20,on%2004%2F14%2F2007)), suggesting a low public profile.
neighbors.influence_justification: No known leadership roles; private resident

approach_recommendations.engage: Reach out in an informal setting (for example, via a mutual acquaintance or neighborly visit) to gauge his perspective. Be prepared to discuss practical issues like road maintenance or scenery, and emphasize that community input is valued.

neighbors.name: Richard L. Wilson & Marilyn Y. Wilson
neighbors.claims: Richard and Marilyn Wilson (husband and wife) own parcel 225-00-06-006 in Anderson County ([it.scribd.com](https://it.scribd.com/document/650687937/Anderson-County-SC-May-2-2023-Sale-Results#:~:text=Anderson%20County%20SC%20May%202,2023%20Sale%20Results)). They are not reported to be active in local civic affairs; the Wilson surname’s local mentions are limited to unrelated public figures (e.g., references to Congressman Joe Wilson) ([www.city-data.com](https://www.city-data.com/elec2/08/elec-ANDERSON-SC-08.html#:~:text=WILSON%20FOR%20CONGRESS%20COMMITTEE%20,on%2001%2F17%2F2007)), indicating this couple stays out of the spotlight.

approach_recommendations.engage: Have a community liaison or familiar neighbor speak with the Wilsons personally. Emphasize aspects like maintaining property values and local control, to reassure them that their interests as homeowners will be protected.
